content.question: If <math alttext="a, sub k, equals, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, to the k power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="k equals, 0 comma 1, comma 2, comma dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>…</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> , which of the following statements about the infinite series <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 0, to infinity, of a, sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is true?
